planets.name: Mercury
planets.description: Mercury is the smallest planet in our solar system and closest to the Sun. It has no atmosphere and experiences extreme temperature fluctuations.

planets.name: Venus
planets.description: Venus is often called Earth's twin due to its similar size. However, it has a thick atmosphere that traps heat, making it the hottest planet.

planets.name: Earth
planets.description: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only astronomical object known to harbor life. It has a diverse climate and rich biodiversity.

planets.name: Mars
planets.description: Mars, also known as the Red Planet, is famous for its reddish appearance and has the tallest volcano in the solar system, Olympus Mons.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.description: Jupiter is the largest planet in our solar system, known for its Great Red Spot, a giant storm, and its many moons including Ganymede, the largest moon.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.description: Saturn is known for its stunning ring system and is the second largest planet in the solar system. It has over 80 moons, including Titan.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.description: Uranus is unique due to its tilted axis, causing extreme seasonal variations. It's a gas giant with faint rings and a bluish-green color due to methane.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.description: Neptune is the farthest planet from the Sun, known for its deep blue color and strong winds. It has 14 known moons, including the largest, Triton.
